column1: '''''Ephel''''' is a [[Sindarin]] noun which means "encircling fence"<ref name="silmindex"/> or "outer fence".<ref name="silmap">[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[Christopher Tolkien]] (ed.)
column3: "Appendix: Elements in Quenya and Sindarin Names"
column4: entry ''pel-''</ref> It is a combination of ''et'' and ''pel''.<ref name="silmap"/>

column2: "the encircling fence of [[Brandir]]";<ref name="silmindex">[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[Christopher Tolkien]] (ed.)
column4: "Index"</ref> often simply called ''the Ephel''<ref name="silmtt">[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[Christopher Tolkien]] (ed.)

column2: "Fence of Shadow";<ref name="silmindex"/> more commonly known as the "Mountains of Shadow"<ref name="lotrbg">[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
